Our team got caught at our red while Kennen and I were heading there, and because they fought well the enemies were around half HP so we decided that we could go clean up. And that's the story of the day I bought Pentakill Sona as a symbol.

I main support, and as often as possible, I try to donate the kill to my carries.  That doesn't mean that I'm afraid to take the kill if they are going to get away (my ADC can't flash/gap-close to get them).  That way, at least my carry gets some sort of gold, lane pressure and free farm.  Now if my ADC has them to one auto, they are in the middle of the lane or have no tower to fall back to, I simply try to buff my ADC to allow them to get the kill as the gold is more useful on them.

People should always try to donate "guaranteed" kills to their carries but should never be afraid to do the killing blow if it's a teamfight or some sort of scrum-like scenario where you have 3v2 or something along those lines.  Or if your ADC is going to die to their ADC if you don't kill them.  

KS'ing only really refers to situations where someone intentionally takes the kill either to grief someone or to be greedy - such as a flash-ability to take a sure kill away from a carry or to grief someone who is struggling.  These do happen - players get greedy and forget to share the gold.  It's not about score, but rather gold and items.  If you view it as a loss to your KDA, then you're looking at it all wrong.

Personally I'd rather blow Flash myself as the support to give my ADC an assist than have them blow their Flash. I feel like his Flash is more precious than mine and I don't think it's worth the gold difference between a kill and an assist. Except like if you're Draven and you have stacks to cash in.

An interesting point.  Plus, if the ADC flashes for the kill, now they can be ganked for shutdown gold.  A support that flashes for the kill probably still won't have a streak and won't be worth as much even if they are ganked while their flash is down.

Of course, if you don't have good communication, they might flash in at the same time you do anyway...
Yeah, there's that, lol. It's better if you're premade with him, you can say like "got it" before wasting both flashes.

While I'd normally agree, there are some exceptions. 

For example. Say, there's a 17/0/2 Lee Sin in game where it's 30 kills to 35 kills, Lee Sin on the losing side. He''s godlike, carrying the team, the reason they haven't FF'd already. But, by the same token, would he _really_ need to flash kick to secure the kill from the laners who could _really_ use the shut down gold since they're so behind?

Now, I know it's irritating since junglers and supports get a lot of flak for things they've no control over, but swap out Lee Sin with a mid lane Leblanc or top lane Riven or whoever, and the example still applies. This example doesn't even specifically apply to last second "kill stealing", although it does still apply.

Other than that though, yeah the concept of KSing is stupid.
I completely  don't care if someone ks me. My mindset when it happens is "ah nuts, well I guess I'll just have to kill harder next time lol!"

Whenever I play adc, i don't mind my support ksing me if i can't get the kill or don't deal enough damage. In fact if they secure the kill then that means I still get gold to spend towards my power items and then carry that support through the end game like how the adc-support relationship is suppose to be

One time I killed a like, 4 tank-item volibear with a Janna W.  The teammate who had been losing a 2v1 against that volibear (and another champion i don't recall) was actually mad at me when I showed up, turned the fight around, and happened to get kill credit.

If I can *intentionally* ks a tank with a zephyr, you shouldn't be mad, you should hail me as a god amongst mere mortals.

If you're playing adc and your supp is better at last hitting champs than you despite your (hopefully) higher crit chance, AS, damage, stop playing adc.


(and I main adc)

Here here. I _can_ ADC, and I think when we're new we almost all are drawn to the allure of ADCing, but I learned early on my last-hitting and twitch speed just isn't up to being a dedicated ADC player, and transitioned to more Mage and Support.

Find your niche. By all means learn to play every role with _some_ degree of competence, but be realistic with your strengths and capabilities.

See, I posted a big thread some time ago offering suggestions for how the game itself could avoid the 'kill steal' thought-process entirely, and the ONLY responses I got were 'the gold is global, it's a kill confirm, this shouldn't be a thing.'

So I stop caring, yeah. Now I just NUKE whatever target I can, either I get it, or the other person(s) get it. About 50% of the time I get accused of kill stealing, being a bad support, whatever. When I do, I just remember that when /I/ whine about it, nobody gives a hoot. So I return the favor.
